title: Hospital Library Information Navigation and Foundational Mathematical Applications Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and mathematics knowledge at the 5th–6th grade elementary level
context.additional_context: Basic education in information retrieval using hospital library systems and mathematical data analysis, with case-based learning focused on understanding medical environments.

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more reliable information sources on a given medical topic by navigating digital resources in the hospital library within the LMS.
Learners can organize hospital operational data into tables and generate simple graphs by applying basic statistical concepts.

Over a 6-month course, learners write 4–6-page mathematical analysis reports applying basic statistics (mean, standard deviation, correlation) using provided datasets. They submit reports achieving 80%+ in 4 of 5 rubric criteria: data accuracy, analytical appropriateness, visualization effectiveness, conclusion validity, and report completeness.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
